intro: Achyrophorus montanus, commonly known as the mountain achyrophorus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
